answers.answer: I didn't have cravings, but had an odd experience with smells.I would walk into a grocery store, and immediately be able to pick out each and every single smell in the store, from coffee to fruit to deli to the bakery...and it would make me reel with nausea.  Just would hit me like a ton of bricks.
i craved subway sandwiches(turkey and bacon)with my first son, and green olives with my second son.
I craved red licorice in early pregnancy, towards the end I craved anything sweet (I had gestational diabetes and was not allowed sweets)

I knew i was pregnant when I craved hot peppers on my pizza and green olives.  Into the pregnancy I craved steak and watermelon and grapefruit.  The smells of coffee and garlic (which I loved prior to getting pregnant) turned my stomach. Strange I know.

I'm 5 months along with my first.  I drink skim milk like it's going out of style.  Anything else is too sweet.  I've heard that if you're low on iron, you'll crave meats and low on calcium you'll crave cheese, milk, etc.  It's possible, I suppose!I often crave a certain pizza, but I craved that before I got pregnant.  It's just more tempting now, even though I can't eat nearly as much as I used to.  Now I just graze over the course of an evening.

question: Hiya people, just wondering out of all you pregnant gals reading what cravings you've had. My mum had cravings for apples with me, and watermelons and bananas with my brother and sister. I am currently craving grapes! Does craving run in families or is our family lacking something in our diet which leads us to crave fruit during pregnancy? Anyone have any ideas? Please post some funny cravings poeple have had, I like hearing other peoples pregnancy experiences! Sarah x
title: Pregnancy Cravings
